1.content:
One day, Matt was looking through his friend's garage.Matt's family themselves had a garage sale recently, so much was cleaned out and sold off, but countless dusty old items remained to be seen. As the two looked through, the sassy blond Sarah, and Matt's sister Jane played ball out front and called to them.

"Ain't you knuckleheads bored of looking yet? There's nothing but dusty lamps and old knick knacks in there." Sarah said. Sarah wasn't particularly as close to the boys, but she was close friends with Jane so tended to spend time with them by association.

"Maybe they'll find some sort of Genie." Jane joked to herself, her short dark hair shining in the sun as she wiped the sweat off her forehead.

Matt and Brandon scavenged through item after item, all fascinating treasures to them. But, they too tired out and got bored with everything each the same after awhile.

"I'm beat. Let's go back inside, I'm sure my mom has made us lunch by now." Matt told Brandon, tired from digging and his hands quite dirty.

"Okay, I'll met you up in a little bit." Brandon said. They bumped fist and went off.

A few minutes passed and Brandon thought he'd go through one more container. It was a dusty case with a silver plating and multi-colored band decorating the handle. He struggled to get it open, but after prying it with a wrench a series of dark coins and colorful gems rained out. He'd be rich! Just fantasying about all the things he could buy with the jewels, Brandon started picking up them up one by one, when a stray artifact had fallen into the corner. Peaking underneath a table to get it, it was different than the others. Ruby red, it was a ring that slipped right around his finger. It glowed a ghastly red haze, and Brandon suspected without a doubt it was magic of some kind.

"Neat! I wonder what this thing can do." Suddenly with those words, it grew hot and pulsed a steaming red as if on a stove, yet it didn't hurt the boy at all. Instead he heard a cryptic voice inside his head.

"If another familiar ye wish to seek, give it a wish and a knock and into you they shall peak!"

"Familiar? Like a friend or relative?" Brandon thought. This must be able to summon forth creatures or help he guessed, of some kind. He thought of all the cool fictional characters that maybe he could try out, but familiar should be someone he was close to right? Without delay, he announced

"I wish Matt's Sister Jane was right here now!"
1.title: A Startling discovery

choices: Jane tries to summon one of her heros
Sarah ask for one of her favorite actors
11.content:
As simple as the wish had been, nothing happened right away. It had glowed a hot red for a moment, but than faded back to it's dull Ruby colored shade. He shook it a bit, but to no avail.

"Dammit, what a ripoff. Still, I guess it's a neat ring." Brandon lamented, as a rustling sound was heard upfront.

"Having fun in here?" A voice echoed. It was Sarah, her blond hair, white camisole and pink skirt standing out in the grimy darkness of the Garage.

"Just finishing up." Brandon told her. He dusted himself off and started to make his way out, basking in the sun again as Jane waved aswell.

Sarah and Jane continued to pass their ball back and forth and bantered with him. "So, did you find anything interesting? A magic genie, or hole to the mole people perhaps?" Jane joked, giving her girlish chuckle.

Her brother's best friend only shrugged. "Nah, nothing too great. There were some mint coins but they're probably worth dirt. But atleast I got this cool ring though," Sarah caught the ball and the two girls stopped and looked over. Indeed there was a gleaming red Jewel on top a lavish ring on Brandon's finger. They both Oooo'd.

"It's supposedly magic or something, since it was speaking earlier. But it just as well could be a cheap toy or something, that lights up and makes noises. I don't know." He shook it slightly and it glowed a pale red.

"I see." Sarah poked it rather curiously. "That could be, but I've never heard of a glowing ring like this, and plus this thing looks ancient. They wouldn't have the technology for that whenever this thingy was made."

"Shucks, It being magic certainly sounds interesting. What does it do exactly?" Jane asked, poking Brandon on the forehead while raising her other pointer against her chin.

"Oh, while it supposedly summons 'Familiars' I think, or seeks them or gives them a peak? I don't know, the voice was pretty vague." Brandon explained.

"Familiars, you mean like a witch?" Sarah posited. "Yeah, I guess."

Brandon scratched his head, while Jane shook his hand staring curiously with the ring. "Goody! That sounds just cool enough to be fascinating! Let's give it a try." She said, grasping it with her hand.
11.title: Examining the Ring

choices: The Wicked Witch of the West
111.content:
"But we still have to make this work. And it didn't work for me. So we need to make it work somehow." Brandon said.

"This voice you heard… it didn't explain much?" Sarah said.

"Nope. It only said, like, one sentence." Brandon replied.

"Well, we need someone to explain it to us then." Sarah stated.

"But who? It's not like there is a Magic Shop around the corner that can just explain to us how this ring I found works perfectly."

"Maybe Sarah was right!" Jane said.

Brandon and Sarah looked at her.

"What do you mean?" Brandon asked.

"Sarah said a familiar, like a witch. Maybe we need to wish for a witch first." Jane replied.

"Aren't most witches evil?" Brandon asked.

"Yeah, Jane, I think we need to be careful and think about this more." Sarah said.

Jane wasn't listening. She was just thinking about who she wants to summon. Jane suddenly thinks about...
111.title: Jane wishes for a Witch

choices: The wicked witch stepmother of Snow White
1112.content:
"A witch huh? There are all kinds of witches. There's Sabrina the Teenage Witch, the Wicked Witch of the West, there are Witches just like in my animes, ooh and Disney Witches too I think!" Jane spouted on, obsessively giddy with the idea of meeting a real witch.

"Jane, are you listening to us? We don't know if this ring really works, but even if it does that sounds pretty dangerous. Most witches are generally evil, and even if not by intention, they tend to be malevolent just be nature." Brandon tried to inform her.

"Hmmhm, do you know how many times Sabrina screwed everything up just by trying to make things better for her with magic? It's a risky business." She stated.

Jane wasn't listening to any of that. She plucked the ring off and held it towards the sun. She didn't know about any magic shops or generic Witch sitcoms, but she'd read plenty of storybooks and seen too many movies and cartoons to not be excited about the prospects of meeting a witch.

Maybe the ring would summon her a familiar? Or maybe it would turn HER into a witch and give her familiar, along with magic. She remembered she loved Disney, there were loads of witches there. Holding it up closely, she began to rub her fingers against it, knocking it against her elbows while she rubbed, and as per her fantasy, a mist emitted out. The ring had been activated.

"Jane, wait don't! NO-" Sarah rushed to Jane's safety and clasped her hands around the ring. It immediately exploded in a gushing stream and colorful vapor. Just seconds prior, Jane had fantasized and wished about meeting...
1112.title: Using the ring hastily

choices: Jane wants to try the Ring
11121.content:
A gush of colorful steam filled the lot, with a thick ooze suddenly flooding atop of Sarah. Jane had been pushed back in the midst of the trauma and now Sarah had been paying the price. "Guys! Mmmmp..Helmmp Mmm!" She struggled, with the liquid quickly finding itself coating her arms and legs, expanding outwards and completely coating her body. Before she could muster another word, it had covered her mouth and head and blinded her vision completely.

Jane and her friend Brandon could only look look in horror as the goo coated her, but luckily only for so long. The mist grew thicker and eventually covered all sight of their sassy and responsible Sarah, who was only trying to prevent Jane from making a bad choice.

It didn't seem to bode well for her however. Sarah could hardly regret it, her mind was in a haze as she felt like she was floating, almost in the air or in water, being scrubbed by a thousand tiny bubbles. She'd lost track of her limbs and senses were amiss, and when they finally began to return they came back stronger and more keen to her than she'd ever known. The mist finally faded, and Sarah felt dry and conscious once again.

Jane's face lit up like the forth of July while Brandon jumped behind her, confused and terrified at what was in front of them.

"Sarah, you're...you're..."

"What, what happened?" Sarah asked, confused and unable to see anything different with her appearance, now resembling a slightly-shrunken Ursula. On one of her human fingers was the Ruby red ring, slowly fading out of it's bright red color and ceasing to vibrate.

"Amazing!" Jane finished, oblivious to all the horror of what had happened, except through her blissful mind thrilled to see the ring worked.
11121.title: Ursula the Sea Witch

112.content:
"Oh, ooooh oh I know! :Let's summon a superhero! Wouldn't that be just so cool if we could do something like that?" The plucky Jane suggested.

"Superhero? You mean as in from a comic book? I don't know, that sounds a little.." Sarah twaddled her thumbs, a little nervous at the idea. It could be rather dangerous to bring forth a live superpowered being into this world, assuming the ring worked as they were suggesting.

"I don't see a problem with it. As long as we bring in a super HERO, and not a villain into the picture. Why not pretend a bit?" Brandon took off his ring and handed it to Jane.

"Yeeah see, Brandon's cool like that. He knows it won't do any harm, plus who hasn't wanted to see a real life Superhero?"

Jane positively bustled with excitement. She slipped the ring giddily onto her finger and raised it up, shimmering the sunlight across it's red jeweled surface. She could hardly wait to bring forth her favorite comic superheros.

"But who should we even summon?" Brandon asked. Only a bit of a marginal fan himself, he wasn't too sure on it.

"Oh, oh I know! Let's bring forth a familiar of.."
112.title: Up Up and Away?

1122.content:
Jane had no trouble thinking through it. There was already one character in mind she would desperately do anything to see one way or another!

.."Batgirl! Let's summon Batgirl!" She said, thrilled at the prospect of meeting her favorite superhero.

"Batgirl eh? Sounds sort of like an odd choice, but I guess we can try it." Brandon agreed. A cloud moved over the sun slightly, and the wind bristled by but otherwise it was mostly silent in their sturdy neighborhood. Matt hadn't come back yet, and he was sure his mom was busy inside anyway. They'd be bored the next few hours if nothing else, so he figured they may as well give it a chance.

"Alright, do you know how to use it? I think you just have to think real hard of the character you love and shake the ring up abit, or something. I don't really know if it works, but that's how I figure it would."

Jane nodded her head and posed sensationally. With a deep breath, she thought hard about batgirl. Her looks and voice, her physical abilities and brave charisma, all the bat-gadgets and skills she honed. With her unshakable determination, as strong as Batgirls herself, to bring forth this wish she shook the ring a bit, and mustered all her might.

"I wish Batgirl was here right now!" Jane shouted.

At that instant, the ring glowed red hot and vibrated. Jane wasn't hurt, but she did feel a cool tingling sensation running up her hand, and than arm. The ring let out a brightly colored gassy mist of vapor and started spraying a gooey liquid all over her, which started spreading up and down her body. Her two friend both panicked, but before they could even reach her the steam had obscured her completely.
1122.title: She is the Night

choices: Jane take takes the Ring off
11221.content:
A cold and tight feeling crept up Jade continually, and than faded just as soon as it started back up. She felt the sensation on her hand and arms, creeping and tightening against her waist and thighs. Finally it coated her head and feet, and although she couldn't see anything, she felt like something was being poured or wrapped onto her. It made her rather light headed, although she retained her conscious awareness.

When she came to her senses, slowly but surely the colored vapor released from the ring faded. Her vision returned and she could feel her poise and awareness returning. The clouded sky came back into view, and soon her neighborhood was visible again.

When everything settled and cleared, her two friends, Sarah and Brandon simply stood in shock. Sarah was covering her mouth pointing, and Brandon just scratched his head, not sure what to make of it.

"What? Is Batgirl here? Where is she." Jane looked around frantically. "Don't see her" She held up her arm, covered in tight sewn leather. "Ring must be dumb prop." She declared in disappointment. She put a gloved hand on her hip and another in her mouth, biting the leather slightly across her masked face, which extended into a hood with two pointy bat ears per any proper Batgirls costume. Her body was was encased in the same shiny, yet sowed up leather black fabric that made up the rest of her new costume, that being a form-fitting bodysuit that seemed more agile on a ninja or crime fighter than it did a young girl.

"Ugh. So hot." She said, pulling off the mask and revealing her sweaty face underneath. It was drastically different, taking up slight oriental features and sharper looks. Her messy black hair was shorter, and even darker than before. Her bodily physique was slimmer, and seemingly more fit. A utility belt latched around her lower waist with a handful of bat-gadgets with it.

"What? See something?" Jane said, breathy yet precise. She seemed a bit more stern, like some bit of life or youth had just been taken out of her.

"Well that sucked. Let's go." But when she smiled briskly like Jane did, the same old dazzling Jane shone through.

She looked at the red ring on her finger, and thought about what to do next.
11221.title: BatJane is born

choices: "I'm not going to allow you to change yourself. You're gonna change me."
"I'm not going anywhere near that thing. I'm fine being myself."
112212.content:
"Stupid ring's probably just some dumb cereal toy anyway." The "new" Jane takes the ring off and turns, tossing it behind her. "I'm headed back inside where Matt is."

Brandon fumbles for the ring before getting ahold of it, then stares with Sarah at the Bat-Jane that walks inside with a much lighter, more alert gait than she did before.

Finally, Brandon turns to Sarah. "What the heck just happened."

Sarah responds, "I... have no idea." She gains a stern expression. "Either way, we need to fix this. Now."

Brandon holds up his hands and says "Now hold on! We still don't know anything about what just happened. We don't even know how we're going to fix Jane yet. Let's learn a bit more about how the ring works before changing anything."

Sarah bites her lip. "Alright. I guess that makes sense. But where do we start? All we know about the ring is that Jane doesn't notice the effects of the ring, but we do."

Brandon puts his hand over his mouth, trying to think of what to do. "Well, all three of us were aware of the existence of the ring. But Jane was the only one who didn't *see* the transformation itself. Maybe, in order to be able to see changes that the ring makes, we have to directly see a change that the ring makes."

He looks up. "I think we should try the transformation thing again."

Sarah looks aghast. "What! Are you crazy!?"

Brandon counters, "We both are aware that the ring changes people, and even if we don't notice any changes, we can trust the other person to tell us that we did change. Plus, we'll be aware that we most likely will have changed anyway."

Sarah sighs. "Fine. You win this one. But..."
112212.title: Jane takes the Ring off

choices: Nanoha Takamachi, from Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha StrikerS
1122122.content:
"I'm not going anywhere near that thing. I'm fine being myself." She crosses her arms. "And that's final."

Brandon nods. "I think I can live with that."

'Now, the only question is, what should I turn into?' He thought. 'I know I want to test how I'm gonna feel being another person entirely. I also noticed some small differences between Jane and Bat-Jane, so I should also consider testing those. Lastly, I want to test to see if powers are copied as well.

With those thoughts in mind, he decided to become...
1122122.title: "I'm not going anywhere near that thing...

choices: "No, I don't feel any different. Did it work?"
11221221.content:
"I wish I was Yukari Yakumo!" Brandon rubs the ring with his fingers and hits it against one of the shelves in the garage. Immediately, the ring spews purple, yellow, and red goop all over him, covering his body and face and concealing him in darkness.

In the darkness, Brandon could still feel the goop shifting his body, expanding, shrinking, tightening his body in different places. Finally, it was over.

As he returned to reality, able to see the world once more, Sarah asked him with a concerned tone, "Brandon? Are you... aware? Of the change?"
11221221.title: Yukari Yakumo, from Touhou

112212211.content:
"Ugh, yeah. Man, that felt weird." Brandon rubbed his head with his new dainty, gloved hand, grimacing. "That was an incredibly uncomfortable transformation. Jane absolutely had to have had her memory altered. There's no way she would've neglected to mention this thing."

When it comes to Touhou, the strange thing about the characters is that, because the art neglects things like how old the characters look and proportions, each character could have any sort of appearance, and each one differs from artist to artist. Brandon was curious as to see what the "canon" or "human" version of Yukari Yakumo would look like. "I'm gonna need a mirror."

Sarah immediately went through the piles of stuff in the garage. "Hold on, I think that my old room had a full-body mirror. Ah, here we go." She pulls out said mirror, and places it in front of Brandon.

Brandon gives himself a once-over. His new body, like he would've assumed based on the character, looks like either an incredibly youthful and sexy 30-year-old or an incredibly sexy and mature looking 20-year-old. He ('She,' he corrected mentally. 'There's no way I can think of this body as male.') had red eyes, long blonde hair with two red ribbons tied on the end of either side of it. She had a long purple dress with a generous amount of cleavage and purple heels that she could tell from the crisscross design were going to be horrible to get off. But there were two things that popped out more than anything else on her.

First, the breasts. As is normal for every fanservice-y anime girl, there was absolutely no way that any pair of breasts would be as large and as perky without either serious surgery or magic. But he didn't even feel any back pain in the slightest.

Secondly, the frills. Oh dear lord the frills. They were on EVERYTHING he was wearing, from the mob cap to dress to even the socks (stockings? They'd be weird version of either one).

"Man, I want to change out of this as soon as possible. I can't live with all of these frills on everything."

Sarah said "I think that there's some old clothes in my mom's room. But anyway, how are you feeling? Do you feel any different?"

Brandon pursed his lips. "I feel... smarter. Way smarter. I want to simultaneously play the greatest prank in history and figure out cold fusion. And I feel strong. Like I could do anything if I put my mind to it, but I'm also too lazy to actually do anything important. All of which are things that Yukari does. But I also can feel that those are sort of... minor compared to my "real" personality? I don't know. Yukari's a very powerful character in Touhou, so she may just naturally be more observant and have more insight into things than I do."

Sarah let out a breath, seeming a lot less tense than before. "Okay, so at least it isn't too major. So we know that, at least for us, our personalities will be at least mostly intact. Now we just have to observe Jane for a bit to see if she's under the same kind of thing."

And, as if saying her name summoned her, Jane opened the door. "Hey, are you guys done in here yet? Dinner's almost ready, and..."
112212211.title: "Ugh, yeah. Man, that felt weird."

choices: You decide to tell her about the change.
You decide to gather more information tomorrow.
1122122111.content:
"I'm absolutely starving." Well, that was one last hope dashed. Jane didn't notice the change at all. Looks like you really did need to see a change in order to notice any.

Brandon and Sarah have a silent conversation on whether or not to tell Jane about the change now or gather more information tomorrow.
1122122111.title: "...I'm absolutely starving."

choices: ...attempt to use some of her powers.
11221221112.content:
The two of them silently agree to not tell Jane yet; the knowledge might prevent her personality from returning to normal. Neither of them know for sure yet.

"Yeah, no. We just finished." Sarah props the mirror up against a shelf. "I'm ready to eat." The three of them walk back inside to have a dinner that is very awkward for two of them.

Later that night, after Brandon already said goodbye to both Sarah and Jane, she finds she can't sleep. Despite how lazy Yukari is, it seems none of that carried over to sleep. "I guess that makes sense," Brandon mutters in her new womanly voice. "It did say that she hibernated. She might just do that instead of sleeping."

Either way, Brandon thinks that she won't be able to sleep if she doesn't do something, so she decides to...
11221221112.title: You decide to gather more information tomorrow.

112212211121.content:
Brandon decides to see if she can use some of Yukari's powers. From what she remembers, Yukari has the ability to "manipulate boundaries." Which is a broad enough power that can stretch from literally summoning a train to knock over opponents to traveling from the Earth to the moon by looking at its reflection in a puddle.

So, Brandon decided to start off with something simple: summoning a gap.
112212211121.title: ...attempt to use some of her powers.

choices: She dismisses the gap, an idea forming
1122122111211.content:
Instantly, before she even lifted up her hand, a purple gash in reality appeared right before her eyes, where she was planning on having the gap located.

Astounded, she stuck her head into the gap, looking around inside to find nothing but eyes as far as she could see. Despite this, she wasn't frightened at all (probably Yukari again).
1122122111211.title: It works

112212211122.content: ...transform again. The question was: Did she want to turn into another Touhou character, or someone from a different series entirely?
112212211122.title: ...transform again.

choices: Reimu Hakurei, the shrine maiden that protects Gensokyo
Keine Kamishirasawa, the attractive history teacher of the Human Village
1122122111221.content:
Brandon decides to keep with Touhou. Maybe it was Yukari talking, but she felt safer keeping with that option than with anything else.

Now, which character did she want to transform into?
1122122111221.title: Keep with Touhou

11221221112212.content:
She decided on Keine, the were-hakutaku from the Human Village.

Taking care to not wake her family, she whispered "I wish I was Keine Kamishirasawa" while rubbing the ring, before tapping it against her bedside and letting the blue, red, and white goop encase his body.

Immediately after the process had finished, Brandon went over to the mirror to look at his new body, admiring her new long blue and white hair, brown eyes, and breasts probably 1.5 times the size of her head. She twirled around in her dark blue dress, admiring her body, before stopping.

Is it possible to turn into EX-Keine when I'm like this? Brandon wondered, unsure if skills and abilities also came along with transformations.
11221221112212.title: Keine Kamishirasawa, the attractive history tea...

choices: She plays around with her new body
She makes observations about the transformation
112212211122121.content:
If Brandon really could use people's powers after turning into them, then maybe she could activate powers just through muscle memory. This is what she tries when she attempts to turn into EX-Keine, focusing on an image of Keine until she feels her body start to shift once more.

After a minute or so, Brandon looks back into the mirror to find her body completely changed: Her blue and white hair's blue became replaced with green, a pair of horns adorned the top of her head, and her breasts were now twice the size of her head instead of just 1.5 times the size.

"Woah..." she breathed, astounded at EX-Keine's beauty. "So I really do get the powers of the people I turn into..."
112212211122121.title: Attempt it

choices: "Could I maybe use Yukari's powers to fix this whole thing?"
"So, what does this mean about the ring?"
112212212.content:
"No, I don't feel any different. Did it work?" Brandon looked himself over. Purple dress, white gloves, long blonde hair, giant breasts... everything seemed to be in place. What about him screamed Yukari?

"Uh, yeah. It really did," Sarah said, staring at his breasts with slight envy. "You don't notice the two giant orbs hanging off of your chest?"

Brandon looked down again, poking his breasts for emphasis. "Well, yeah, but I just thought those were normal for me to have..." he trailed off. "...But I'm a guy, and guys don't have breasts. Holy sh*t, this is powerful. I was expecting a change, and I still didn't notice anything was off until you pointed it out, and I already was open to the idea of a change happening."

He sat down on the ground, putting his hand on his forehead as he tried to think.
112212212.title: "No, I don't feel any different. Did it work?"

114.content:
"Oh, well okay. I don't really know too much about how it works, just once you wish for something any maybe shake it enough it glows a lot." He told Jane, who quickly slipped it off his finger and onto her own.

"Do you have any idea who it could summon? Goodness gracious, do they have to be real, or somewhere nearby?" she asked.

"No clue. Your guess is as good as any."

"Hmm.." Jane pondered curiously at the ring. She gave it a firm shake and watched it glow seething red only to cool down again quickly after. She thought of all the people and characters and ideas she knew, and they almost seemed to fuel it, just as her intense examination fueled her desire to use it.

"Why don't you suggest someone? Might as well see if it works." Sarah said, sighing and dribbling the ball a bit more.

"But trepidation! There are so many ways that could work, how do we know if it even works? Who would we 'summon' anyway?" Jane questioned insistently. Finally Brandon wasn't about to let anymore pointless speculating over it any longer. He'd see it's use for himself.

Putting a hand on Jane's ring finger and tapping it slightly, he said,
"I sure wish we could have with it us..."
114.title: Brandon suggest a character

choices: Sarah gets curious and wants to try the ring
1141.content:
"I wish we could summon Jessica Rabbit!" Brandon said. He thought the wish was silly, and didn't actually think anything would happen. But the idea of Jessica Rabbit just appearing before them out in their parking garage was almost too funny to pass up.

The ring glowed a scarlet red and shook slightly. "It's working! Do it again!" Jane suggested, shaking it slightly and pressing it against her other palm as if shaking a soda can.

"I wish Jessica Rabbit was here already!" He repeated.

Jane continued shaking as hard as she could and gave herself a laudable swing to her cut in a typical egregious fashion, making "Boom" and other sound effects with her voice as she did. Finally the ring started vibrating and glowed red hot. It didn't burn Jane at all, but a thick liquid began to spray out, quickly covering Jane's arm.

"Agggggh what's happening?!?" Jane shouted. Steam poured out of it immediately spraying Jane in the face.

"Jane!"

Sarah and Brandon panicked and rushed to remove the ring, but it wouldn't pull off and was rather hot for them, forcing them back with slight aversion to the burn.

They could do nothing but watch as the liquid continued to pour, shifting a gooey red, purple and whitish-cream color as it poured onto Jane's body. It was quickly eloping her like a large blob of melted fondue, and practically down to her knees when she vanished from sight. The thick steam basked her, and grew thick enough to obscure her two friends vision. Jane herself felt somewhat lightheaded, but strangely enough her vision and control were starting to return, and the warm vapor of the steam cooled off.

By the time it started to fade, Sarah and Brandon could only stare in shock.

"G..guys? Am I okay, Darlings?" A sensual and smooth voice cooed, as a much older women came out of the clearing mist.

"Jane? Is that you?" Brandon asked.

"Of course it is Darling. That was sure some scare huh, I ain't seen nothing like it." The new 'Jane' said. Replacing her young adorkable appearance, was now one identical to that of a slightly Modified Jessica Rabbit.

No doubt Jane now seemed older, although as "Jessica" the character seemed younger. Her hair was a ginger shade, sporting Jessica's fabulous curvy bangs in front of her hair, although it was still significantly short in the back, even if more wavy. Her frumpy blouse was fused with a rubbery red fabric that meshed into a long dress, the trademark one Jessica Rabbit wore. She had one short purple opera glove, and an arm-length one that Jessica wore. Her face was made up with full red lips, blue eyeshadow, and makeup that basically gave her the face of the saucy cartoon character, but on Jane's head, or slightly altered head. Two red heels decorated her feet, with her legs extended out.

Jane had become a miniature Jessica Rabbit!

Brandon and Sarah stood, eyes wide open and unable to believe what they had just seen. "Jane", as she either 'now' referred to herself as, or still did simply swung her hips sexily and posed herself towards them. "What's wrong? That nasty O' ring didn't mess up my beautiful face, now did it? Ah shucks, just my luck. What a gobblestopper that doozy was" She said, raising her arm atop her head and staring out dreamily as if posing for a camera, before snapping out of it as if realizing she was out of character. (For Jessica Rabbit that is)

Sarah, although still freaked out simply said. "S..sure." She passed the ball to Jane, who caught it barely as always. Jane was naturally sporty, but ironically not too athletic owing to her stature. With her skinnier but dainty body and mannerisms, she caught it with even less grace than usual.

Brandon looked once more at the ring in her possession as they awkwardly resumed their game of catch. He contemplated carefully on it. With an item like that in their possession, who knows what might be possible.
1141.title: Jane Rabbit is born!

11411.content:
Brandon couldn't believe his eyes. Just mere moments away, Jane was the mawkish little sickly sweet friend he'd always known, plain Jane. And yet now she looked like a bombshell straight out of a movie scene, even if she was still her in some ways. How had such a mere ring been given the powerful to transform someone so drastically.

Brandon thought about taking the ring off her, but against his better judgement, and curiosity, he didn't. Sure maybe she might transform back, but whose to say he might not accidentally make it permanent? It was too risky.

All he could do was watch the new Jane, flutter her eyes and pose sexily while still oddly, playing the role of the old Jane. She caught and passed the ball as before. She skipped and fluttered as his friend always did. When she missed it one time, she made a familiar quip about it. It wasn't just like she was merely replaced by Jessica Rabbit, it was like Jessica Rabbit had 'replaced her' in a way, and was now trying to play and act out the role of Jane as best she could.

Although she was mostly successful, the weirdly feminine and sometimes sexual way she sometimes did it certainly seemed at odd with Jane's normal charm. When she tripped in one instance, rather than over-reacting and dramatically joking like Jane always did, she cooed and lamented like a Hollywood star on a set, not in a silly friendly Janey fashion but in a sensual Jessica one..

It was that which reminded Brandon that Jessica was really just a "Character" of sorts, a fictional one and a cartoon at that. She wasn't a real actor or movie star or anything, how would anybody expect her to act playing a dorky young teen? She seemingly now Jessica Rabbit's had personality and mindset, but still had to act as herself, so her trying to stay as Jane seemed a bit conflicting. Also, she didn't see any of this just as terribly weird as it was.

Suddenly, the three heard a call nearby.
11411.title: Brandon follows Jane and observes

choices: Jane wants to try the Ring again
114111.content:
"Jane, it's time for lunch! Oh and the rest of you guys can come in I guess. My mom made a lot and considered you might be hungry." Matt appeared behind their door, calling them in.

"Oh, well thanks. Come on guys let's eat." Brandon started making his way before Sarah grabbed him by the arm.

"Are you stupid? Of course we cannot just go in there. We cannot just leave Jane like this, I mean look at her!" Sarah insisted, pointing to the fumbling Jessica-Rabbitified Jane. (Or alternatively Janeified Jessica Rabbit) She relentlessly chased the ball as it went down the driveway, tripping once before retrieving it. She swirled it around and dribbled it playfully like Jane was often known to do in her own youthful manner.

"What's the problem? So what if it's strange, we can fix it later. Besides Jane doesn't really seem bothered by it at all. She doesn't even notice! And neither did Matt so.."

Sarah wasn't swayed.

"Brandon, please. We've got to fix this." The two looked at Jane closely, until she finally started coming in and asking what they were staring at. They mumbled and shook their heads, not sure how to respond or even if they should. The blond of the two sighed and comfort Jane, playing catch abit again.

"Jane, do you see anything, anything at all odd with this scenario."

Jane thought carefully, biting her deep red painted lips with her still-buck teeth. It was only after she missed the ball and it bounced off her head that she replied.
"Yes. YES!" She jumped.

"Really? You do." Sarah said thrilled.

"Yes! My...shoelaces are untied." She said, before leaning down and noticing sparkly red pumps. "Woops, I guess I don't have shoelaces. I can be so forgetful at times darling." Sarah was about to bank on that. It seemed like a failing at first, but hadn't she noticed now that her shoes were different? She remembered that her previous dressy flats didn't have laces, but maybe it was something?

"Well, we should go in now. It sure is a shame that the magic ring didn't work. Let's try this sweet little gem anytime." She said in Jessica Rabbits voice, swaying her hips as she walked inside, before falling to Jane's norm again and tripping soundly.

"You really should be more careful sister." Her brother Matt said, helping her up.

"Thanks Matty darling!" Jane was beaming.
114111.title: Jane's brother, Matt

1141111.content:
"Hmm, cool ring Jane. Where'd you get it exactly?" Matt asked her.

She flashed it around and nuzzled it on her cheek. "Oh, this little old thing? It was a gift from Brandon, found in our old garage I suppose. Apparently it's magic but, we haven't really figured out how to use it yet."

Sarah watching nearby tapped her foot nervously. How was it that Jane couldn't realize how different she looked, and how she'd just transformed into Jessica Rabbit? Was the person in front of her even still Jane? She was certainly acting like it, or trying atleast. She did seem a little different appearance aside, maybe it was making her think and act like Jessica? No, Jessica Rabbit was some slinky cartoon bombshell who lived for the stage and her trademark gloves and red dress. She wouldn't be caught dead just playing ball or talking to her 'Brother' suddenly, but Sarah couldn't help but notice some of the same dainty mannerism were there. While she clearly thought she was Jane, she wasn't always acting like it. Acting very well anyway, not to insult her long time friend but how hard would someone really have being Jane?

Lost in her thoughts, Jane and Matt were talking about the rings themselves Sarah noted. "Wait, what are you guys doing! Be careful with that, you don't know what it's capable of!" she shouted, trying to prevent another strange mishap like what had happened to the young teenage girl that use to be Jane.

"Well duhhh, it clearly didn't work before. But that's why we have to try it again Sarah! So we can meet familiars or whatever. Don't be such a worry-wart toots" Jane said.

"Jane seems to trust in it, so I'm cool with it. At worst it probably won't even work, but who know?" Her brother Matt suggested.

Sarah clenched her hands, but Jane was already anxious to try it. She shook her hands and swung her arms in unusual poses and indirectly triggered the ring. With a sensual melodic voice, she said, "I wish we could bring forth.."
1141111.title: Jane wants to try the Ring again

1141112.content:
'Jane' Rabbit picked herself up and jumped up and down. She fluttered about frantically, cooing and ahh'ing, worried that she'd stubbed her toe or broke a nail, complaining in a dramatic and yet overdone and rather silly fashion, making the Unwieldy and gawkish charm of Jane mesh weirdly with Jessica Rabbits usual starlet self. It was like watching Jessica Rabbit herself suddenly lose everything that made her, her, and instead given the mind (and stature) of a dorky young girl.

"I'm okay guys, really. Just fumbled was all sweeties." She assured her friends. Sarah clenched her first and hastily made her way up to Jane, having had quite enough.

"Sarah wait, don't!" Brandon shouted.

It was too late, she'd reached over Jane's dainty and slick gloved hand and plucked off the ring. "Enough of this already, I've got to fix this. This is just getting ridiculous." She announced, as she placed it on her own finger. "Now how does this work?"

Brandon tried to prevent another mishap and the take the ring off himself, but Sarah held tight to it.

"What are you-..err doing. Stop, stop that! I'm trying to reverse it already!" She shouted.

Close by, Matt sipped a cup and stared on confused. What were those two doing, and why were they wrestling over some silly ring? Jane walked behind him and put her gloved arms sensually around his back, nuzzling him somewhat before being called back over.

"What the darn devil are you two doing now? We tried this, the ring didn't work you silly squirts." She announced, sighing and hoping she could break them apart. As she did, their confrontation pushed her back.

"Wait, Jane I'm trying to help!" While they were struggling for the ring, they had shaken it immensely. It was still lodged on Sarah's finger, so when she focused quickly and said "I wish you were Jane again!" The ring shook violently and with a deep red glow, exploded outwards a trail of steamy gas and fluids.

The victim of it's latest activation was..
1141112.title: Sarah trys to fix this

11411121.content:
"Wait, Jane I'm trying to help!" While they were struggling for the ring, they had shaken it immensely. It was still lodged on Sarah's finger, so when she focused quickly and said "I wish you were Jane again!" The ring shook violently and with a deep red glow, exploded outwards a trail of steamy gas and fluids.

The ring's next victim, was none other than Sarah. She screamed a high-pitched squeal before the ring's effect took hold, it's quickly foaming steam and liquid covering her mouth and body with a fleshy colored liquid that she couldn't escape or avoid with the ring on her finger.

"Sarah! I'm so sorry, just, just hold on!" Brandon said, trying to reach in and save her, only to retract his hands from the steaming hot meld that was erupting out. He didn't manage to remove the ring, but interestingly much of the residue had clobbered and soaked onto his hands. It spread and coated them, but ultimately stopped somewhere midway across his arms.

What was left was distinctly slimmer and more feminine, rather attributable to Jane. He hardly worried about it at the moment, because Sarah's changes were distressingly more extreme. When the steam cleared and gooey liquid that had spun out over her finally cooled and dried, what was left in the kids sight was a completely identical copy of Jane, made out of what was previously Sarah. Covering her eyes, she finally opened them, and gave a huge sigh of relief.

"Oh thank god. It didn't work or change me, I'm still me." Sarah exclaimed. However her content expression changed when she saw that of the others, staring at Jane, Brandon and Matt staring surprised back at her.

"What..what happened to you? Why do you look like my sister? Did you become.."

"Me!" Jane shouted interrupting Matt.

Sarah, and that is to say 'Jane's' face looked like I'd just been hit by a truck. Wide eyed and horrified, she suddenly had realized what'd happened. After Jane's transformation into a Janeified Jessica Rabbit and yet obliviousness she could only put together the strange fate that had befallen her.

"Oh, oh god. Holy shucks, I look like Jane now, somehow don't I?" Sarah said. Despite not being able to perceive or see it, she could clearly reason that this was to be true. And the nervous nods from her friends only confirmed it.
11411121.title: Sarah get's Janey

choices: Jane is 'Jane' again, but there's a hitch?
The ring reverts Jane back successfully
114111211.content:
"You mean, I really look like that fabulous Jessica Rabbit right now? Red show dress, Purple gloves, hair and all?!?" Jane asked, excited yet confused at this revelation. She looked into the mirror window of her mother's car, but could only see herself as Jane. She cooed and attempted to chuckle, but it came out more sensual than Jane's usual amusement.

"Yes, that's right. You've been acting a little more like her to, or well, it's kind of like your her and she's trying to act like you to be honest. To varying degrees." Sarah explained.

Jane felt about her body groped herself slightly. Her shiny opera gloves, her dress, her new cleavage. She felt slightly enticed, but at the same time let down.

"I do see what you mean doll. I can sort of, feel myself and it is different, very different. I'm clearly different or feel very different, but whenever I try to think of myself as Jessica Rabbit, or see myself all that comes up is this idea of this girl known as Jane, plain old Jane. No offense." She told Sarah.

"None taken." Sarah snickered.

"Wait, what was that?" Matt raised an eye and cocked a glare.

"What's what?" Sarah said.

"You just.. the two of you sorta, well you pointed out or acted like you weren't yourselves. The way you just referred to my sister and you was like, you treated them like separate people."

"Did I? Oh myyy." Jane said. "Oh your right. What am I talking about, 'No Offense'? I am Jane, or atleast definitely think of myself as her. Why did I saw it like that, this situations stickier than honeycakes on sausages."

"Trepidation! Truly a conundrum." Sarah said.

Jane crackled. "You know that's not how I usually talk."

"Oh right. I guess since I've known her, you assuming and all, maybe that's how I imagined it."

The two had a laugh and carried it further.

"Do I really laugh like that?" Jane asked giggling.

Sarah couldn't help but dabble in the humor as well. "No, well maybe? Technically this is me, that being you as Jane trying to intimate my laugh. It's like asking you as your normal Jane self to mimic me." She unforcibly carried on.

"I think I'd do a better job at that." Her friend insisted.

"Well you can try later. If you tried now, I'd be Jessica Rabbit speaking, and trying to be Jane making her bad impression of me." The two burst into laughter, actually finding it kind of silly once they got around the strangeness of it all.

"Ugh, enough of this. This is ridiculous. Let's just try fixing all this. Brandon suggested, taking off Sarah's ring and offered it to Jane. "Look, this should be simple. If it transformed you into these characters and different people, all that should be required was a wish to turn back right? Just say something like, 'I wish to be Jane' and it should go smoothly."

The two girls thought about it for a moment, and agreed. Jane bit her glove off, although to her perspective she was merely putting her finger on her chin. "Yes, let's." She put out her hand and Brandon placed the ring on her finger.

"This has been fun, but I think I'd like to be perfectly truly me again darlings, instead of just a different person thinking I'm me and pretending I am."

Matt rolled his eyes, and hoped nervously that this would work.

Jane posed flatteringly like Jessica Rabbit might, and dangled the ring in front of her provocatively.
"Make me Jane again, fully Jane." She demanded.
114111211.title: To fix everything

114112.content:
Suddenly the three heard a call nearby. It was from Jane's mother, who peaked in through the door and had announced that lunch was ready for her "Favorite little dumplings."

Jane responded back "Coming mama!" sexily. She than skipped while trying to perform an odd swaying with her hips and thighs.

Sarah looked at Brandon again. 'Did their mother notice?' was a question heavy on both their minds.

Sarah pointed to her pointer finger silently and pretended to slip off a ring, nudging her head towards the vastly changed Jane.

Brandon merely shook his head and swiped his arms, trying to persuade the action off. Sarah grumbled and started to join Jane inside, with Brandon only shrugging and leaving the pavement. Soon after they were in the kitchen where a table of sandwiches and sodas were laid out on the table. The two sat down, while Jane took her time trying to sensually place herself on a seat, crossing her legs with slight discomfort.

As they began to eat, the two could only shiver as they saw Jane, in her new body attempt to act as usual but so still came off so differently. When she ate her sandwich, it was sloppy and weird the way she engorged it, but more than usual. Because rather than it being Jane's usual appetite, it was Jessica Rabbit trying to imitate Jane eating, with crude results. They even saw her sort of shiver up repulsed herself, showing even she couldn't handle it.

"You know darlings, maybe I'm not that hungry afterall." Jane said, washing it down with a coke anyway.

114112.title: Matt and Jane's mom

choices: Channel surfing for the young and beautiful
1141122.content:
Brandon clenched his palms, somewhat nervous at his good friend's entrance. Normally he'd be fine to see him, but after what happened to Jane, his sister, he could only begin to phantom what he'd do.

The older brother Matt stretched and yawned, and slowly made his way to the table. Completely contrary to Brandon's fears, Matt simply greet him and Sarah, and than his sibling Jane.

"Hey Bro! Fabulous lunch we're having, eh? Perhaps you'd like to join us?" The Jane-turned-JessicaRabbit said. She gave a sly wink, and Matt said "Sure sis."

He pulled up a set and say himself down next to her, and pulled back his sleeve slightly, with Jane pulling off her shorter glove. They clapped hands, did a little twirl with their fingers and, a heart symbol and a spin followed by a poke to each others cheeks. It was an endearing sibling ritual Brandon had seen the two do countless times before, but there was something definitely different about seeing it now that Jane had turned into a young bombshell.

The awkwardness didn't stop, as Matt poured Jane some more soup and 'spoonfed' her some of it, or tried to anyway. The sort of cutesy brother-sister behavior wasn't unknown to Brandon, even if he thought it was unbearably lame. But what would he know, it's not like he had any any sisters, he reasoned. But now it was, certainly a different sight to witness.

"Cut it out Matty darling, you know I'm too old for that sort of thing bro." She insisted.
"Oh, are you sure? Well when are you too old for some tickledsayswhat?" He asked.

"What?" She asked, her raspy voice more soothing and endearing than ever,

"Ahahaha! What is right!" With that, affectionate exclamation Matt jumped over and started tickling Jane, sending her into fits of giggles uncontrollably. He fingered about her dress and groped around her elbows and armpits and waist, sending her into a flurry. "No darling, hahahaaa oh god stop..Brooo nooo!" She objected, trying playfully and fruitlessly to shake him off.

When they were finally done, she had almost fallen out of her chair, and was breathing heavily giggling like a school girl. "Well, enough of that. I need to eat up and finish my homework after, so no more bro. And you need to eat up too, and grow up big and stroong." She poked his nose and lined her way down to his chin, flicking him slightly.

When their little sibling charade ceased, Sarah and Brandon looked at each other again. Brandon almost couldn't help bursting into a small chuckle, even though he knew it was probably terribly disturbing on some level.

"That's just about enough!"

Sarah grit her teeth furiously, and got up suddenly as if about to make a dash. Brandon grabbed her shoulder and said "Yes, I think we've all had enough by now. Why don't we just eat up quickly and go see what's on tv later. Jane, why don't you do your work with us while we hang out. If you don't mind?" He slowly yanked Sarah down and with infuriating reluctance, sat her back in her seat, still eyeing Jane's ring that had caused this absurd little scene. He picked up Sarah's sandwich and started stuffing it into her mouth, giving her the cue to keep quiet. She grumbled as she chewed, and spit it out on her plate.

"Yippers skippers, you know it doll!" Jane said, the first plucky phrase her confirmation for 'yes', and the second an alluring one from another source.

Sarah 'hmmped' and quietly slurped her soup.

12.content:
The ring glowed slightly, but than it stopped.

"What, it didn't work? Why didn't it work?" Brandon wondered. He held his breath and tried shouting it again,

"I wish Matt's Sister Jane was right here now!" It glowed red momentarily, but didn't do more than that.

Again, nothing happened. "Dammit, why won't it work!" He fussed and complained. Frustrated, he knocked it against a stray table, and than rubbed it against his own clothes.

"Stupid piece of junk. I don't know why I thought it would work anyway. Plus Jane is right outside, why would it even do anything?"

At that moment, it started seething red again, only this time it vibrated on his finger and steam emitted out. "Woah, what? The shaking or something must have set it off. Just needed a little bump is all!" Also emitted, was a clear liquid, except as it flowed and wet his hand it started to fade a cream color against his skin and running like wet paint.

"Woah what's happening! This, isn't what I wished for!" And yet, the ring continued to flow. The runny liquid poured and ran up his arm, coating it so and sticking itself to his body. As hard as he pulled on the gooey film, it only spread to his other arm and chest. The steam obscured his vision and started forming the same sensations across his face. Soon before long it had crawled across his body completely, his entire figure obscured by the steam. His head felt hazy, like he was going to pass out. And that's practically what he did, but a strange jolt brought him back to his sense before he fell over and the steam finally started to clear.

When it was done, he rubbed his eyes and tried dusting off his clothes. Hmm, black blouse, white undershirt, red skirt, mary jane shoes, white knee-high socks. Everything seemed to be in order, and strangely wasn't wet or anything. The ring slowly simmered down and finally stopped vibrating, returning to it's normal color. He certainly felt strange, but not sick or anything.

Looking into a shiny surface, he saw a pale, freckle faced girl with glasses, short black hair, a stubby nose and clearly female physique staring back. He was completely identical to Jane, but noticed nothing different in herself even after having transformed into her physically.

"Nothing even happened? How uncool. It was probably just a stage prop for a magician I suppose. Well, I best get moving. This evening wasn't so splendid, didn't even find any genies for shucks sake." She said, somewhat more quizzical and curious than usual, and releasing an uncharacteristic chuckle out followed by a playful skip he normally wouldn't consider doing.

With the change having occurred, the new "Brandon" skipped along.

122.content:
Note: Pronouns fitting a character’s biological form will be used, no matter what they feel on the inside. So, if a guy turns into a girl, I will use “her”. Also, all of the characters are 15 years old.

“Oh, hey, Jane.” Brandon said in her new, higher-pitched voice as he got outside and walked past the girl.

Jane felt a peculiar feeling of familiarity. She had never heard this voice before, yet some intuition was telling her she knew it somehow. At first, she assumed it was another girl who happened to know her name, so she turned to see who the stranger was.

She was shocked to see the back of someone who was wearing the same clothes she was and whose hair looked identical to hers.

“Wha?” the real Jane sputtered before she felt a tap on her back.

Startled, she whirled around to see her friend Sarah, who warned her to be quiet and led her to the garage. Her brother Matt was also standing there and looked very anxious.

“All right, what the hell is happening?!” Jane exclaimed. “Why is there someone who looks like me outside?”

“OK, OK.” Sarah sighed. “Me and Matt saw Brandon use some kind of magic ring he took from one of our bins. I think something was...alive in there. Because he acted like something in his head was talking to him about “familiars” or whatever.“

“I told Sarah that things could get dangerous if you interacted with Brandon’s new body.” Matt explained. “It might cause an unnecessary freakout. Also, Brandon left the ring behind. I’m going to try it on myself.”

“What?!” Jane exclaimed. “Matt, that could be dangerous!”

“I have to test if the ring’s effects can be undone. It might cause some unnecessary conflict if I explained to Brandon what was happening. And I’m not letting you put yourself in danger by changing. So, that only leaves me. I have to test the extent of any personality changes and if any superpowers transfer over if I wish to turn into a fictional character. I have a hunch anyone who sees the changes are made aware of them. I think that’s why Sarah and I noticed the changes, and Brandon didn’t. So, I’ll look into a mirror when I change.”

With those thoughts in mind, he decided to become...

choices: An MSPA like Problem Sleuth or Homestuck
Talking cats are fun right? Prequel or Lackadaisy than
132.content:
Brandon wasn't always the most avid comic reader,but there were plenty of comics of a different kind he occasionally liked. Webcomics, a new and growing medium of comics displayed on the internet! With the availability of all of technology at their disposal, people had begun drawing digital comics and posting them on the web. These usually had higher themes and artwork than the usual variety of comics, for example the page size, 'canvas' and restrictions that might limit an artist on paper no longer existed. Some of them were even done with animations or fancy web tricks!

Brandon had read quite a lot in his day. He was an avid reader of old sprite comics, like 8 bit Theater. There were countless slapstick comics, and plenty about videogames, such as VGcats, Ctrl+Alt+Delete, and Penny Arcade. Of course those were gag strips, not ones built for story or character.

Some of the more popular ones filled that niche however. Like the infamous MSPaint Adventures, which detailed the adventures of both Detective explores Sleuthing Problems, and the nefarious Homestuck, which told a a very long Scifi fantasy epic. It had so many characters, from aliens to jackals and goths and robots and everything inbetween, I'd be an extravaganza to meet someone from there. There was also the bastard child of MSPA, Prequel which was about Katia Managan, a khajiit (talking cat person) trying to start a new life, while facing mystery, magic and tragedy. Based on the Elderscrolls videogame series, Brandon thought it would be truly novel to be able to talk to Katia, and all her hard struggles and adventures.

The webcomic 'Lackadaisy' was also about walking talking cats, slick in their vest and cloaks as they performed high felons in a 20's era Prohibition romp ride.

And than there was Gunnerkrigg Court, the story of Antimony Carver and her days in a magical school, full of paranatural and stupendous adventure. As a Spiritual medium between her school's technologically advanced court, and the spiritually, magically inclined forested woods, she was a literary wonder-child. Being intelligent, patient and crafty, explorative and with quite a few stories of her own, the young redheaded girl always attracted ghosts, gods, spirits, and other beings. Just talking to her would be a goldmine, if the ring could really summon anybody.

He was taller, his hair was now bluish black, spiked at the back with locks at each side of his face and bangs over his forehead. His new blue eyes stared at his new reflection with a confused look. Even his clothing were not spared from the change. He wore Noctis's leather outfit and a black gauntlet over his left hand. Yet, the ring still remained on the same finger on his right hand.

Immediately after he knocked the ring against the table, Brandon found his face being splattered with multicolored goop, able to make out silver, gold, and blue before it completely coated his face, preventing him from seeing anything.

Through his surprise, he noted that he could feel... something, some part of him, stretching or shrinking, as he felt the goop cover his entire body.

Finally, it stopped, and his eyes snapped open, able to see once more.
1343111212.title: Female Corrin

choices: Nope, still thinks breasts are normal

13431112121.content:
Brandon looked back down at the ring, which looked no different than it did half a minute ago. He examined it from all angles, trying to find any hint of that goop that had blinded him temporarily.

"What are you?" He muttered, before slipping it off his hand and into his pocket–

"–huh?" He must've not put on pants with pockets today, as he couldn't feel his hand slip into any fabric. "Nevermind then."

After putting the ring back on his finger (despite his best judgement), he decided to stop going through that last box. His energy did have to end somewhere, after all.

He got up from where he was and stretched, arching his back in the process. He then made his way over to the garage door, careful not to step on anything lest he hurt his...

...wait.

"Why can I feel the ground? I remember putting shoes on before I got out here." He looked down, past his breasts, to find his feet bare.

"...Okay, what?"

Does he put the pieces together yet?
13431112121.title: "What in the heck was that?!"

He didn't want to rush the decision either. It's not like he needed to rush into this. He had time to make the perfect decision. And so he continued to think.

Brandon thought about the Disney characters he grew up with for a moment. There was a strong history there. I mean, he had seen all the old films like Snow White and Dumbo and Peter Pan and all of those films, and there were plenty of cool options to choose from there. And that's before getting into the more recent work from Disney like The Little Mermaid and Aladdin and Tarzan and Tangled, and even their most recent film, Frozen.

Brandon nearly salivated at the thought of bringing one of those classic characters to life. So he decided that he would bring a Disney character to life, right before his very eyes. But what Disney character would he choose? He still had so many ideas.

From the times he cried over Sleeping Beauty and Bambi, to all the laughs he had over Emperor's new groove and The Princess and the Frog. He loved how some of the movies depicted diverse characters, like Mulan or Pocahontas. Some were about brave Princesses, and many with talkative cartoon animals and living creations.

There was no doubt in his mind that he'd try to bring to life a character from Disney. The only dilemma in his mind was about which one to do. There were just so many, and he could hardly choose! Bringing a Princess in his garage might be cool, but also incredible weird. She'd certainly be confused. A talking animal more so, since he wouldn't know how to explain it to people. There were some choices he figured that would be close enough to his modern society that it wouldn't cause a stir up, but the downside of that was, I'd probably be a pretty boring choice at that. At least, much less interesting than a fantastical one. However, mundane as it might be, he realized that might be the best possible choice for now until he could assess how powerful the ring was. He figured if he brought forth a guy, they'd be less of a hassle. Sure not all Disney Princesses would just run and scream, but some weird line of thought told him if he did a guy first things would just go smoother

He'd have to think carefully about what sort of choices he chose, if the ring really did work as the vague voice said, it could bring about a great deal of pandemonium.

That would be for later. For now, one of his favorite male Disney Heroes would suffice rather nicely.

But who? Again, so many choices, how could he pick? Well, it'd have to be someone he'd enjoy hanging out with, right? And with that thought, Brandon thought of the Emperor Kuzco, from The Emperor's New Groove.

The Emperor's New Groove was a funny movie, and much of that was because of the energetic, smarmy, selfish Kuzco, who started off the film by having a glorious wake-up routine. 1543.content:
"Maybe I should test it first? It could be rather risky. Bringing forth a dog probably couldn't hurt" Atleast he thought so. He wondered if he summoned a cartoon dog, would he be able to talk to them? Or would it be like in the show where only specific people can? For the purposes of the test he supposed it didn't matter .He'd have a miracle machine literally in his hands if it worked at all.

He remembered a cartoon that he and Jane left on when he hung out with her sometime. What was it called, Pound preppy, Preppy puppies? Well something like that. He distinctly focused on how Jane's favorite dog was the little one, Cupcake he recalled. It seemed like an adorable enough character, how could such a decision go wrong?

Visualizing the silly cartoon dog, he held the ring up and started shaking his fist, setting off a bright red light on the Ring. "I wish the dogs from Pound Puppies were out here to meet me and my friends!" He said, only being able to envision the small one especially.

Suddenly the ring exploded in steamy release. Brandon coughed on the gas filling is lungs as the Ring flashed a scarlet red and vibrated, spraying out creamy liquid across his arm. It spread up his shoulders, through his top and soon throughout his whole body. His screams of protest were quickly muffled by the covering sticky white foam, forcing him to pucker up a pair of puppy lips, forming a muzzle. Brandon was quickly made immobile, the goo had covered every part of him and he felt it squeeze and compress tightly over his body, which could only wiggle and struggle as it underwent a major metamorphosis.

Brandon's senses slowly faded out as his body felt numb. He felt like he was floating in a neverending sea, without sight or sound. And than just as quickly as started, the strange feeling evaporated. He could slowly feel his strength returning and sight returning to him. The numbness gave way to strange new sensations, and his sense of smell was magnified indefinitely.

When he'd come back to the world, his body was a bit more, feral. He had been replaced by..
1543.title: This town's gone to the dogs

choices: Meeting the new Jane and Sarah
15432.content:
When Brandon had come back to the world, he was most definitely changed. He was standing on all four paws which had replaced his arms and legs, with soft white fur covering them. The white covered his bottom and the bottom of his canine chin, and above the muzzle and his back the fur shaded a peachy cream color. A wet black nose adorned the very tip of his face, with two doggy eyes across his widened face. He was only about a good foot and a half high and 2 feet wide from his scruffy tail to his nose. Brandon raised his paws, unable to decipher the drastic change that had occurred. A pink bow lay atop his head, and a black collar rung around his neck. His member had been replaced with a canine slit at the back of his hind quarters, and if anyone were to have checked he, or rather she'd be marked as a female.

Not only that, but Brandon had become for all intents and purposes a dog. And with her heightened cute appearance, a slightly cartoon one at that, specifically Cookie from the children's show "Pound Puppies.

"It didn't work. I guess the ring's just a cheap piece of junk after all dangit." Brandon-turned-Cookie said, sounding like high pitched bark to an unpresent listener.

Weirdly, her clothes were still around her. Her red and white sports shirt still around her doggy waist, her denim jeans now crouched along her canine forelegs. Cookie's red ring was still lodged around one of her claws at her forepaw.

Giving a disappointed yelp, she figured she better join the others and see if they found anything more interesting than treasure-hunting in a dusty old garage. Brandon walked and hopped her away around the trash and junk and with a slight concentrated press of a paw, lifted the garage shutter.
15432.title: Cookie

info.brief_description: What if you could transform into characters? What if they lived your life instead of you?
info.description:
Fictional Character Transformations Begin with a Twist!


One day you find a magical ring. This ring let's you create costumes and appearances for yourself, only it becomes real! With limitless transformational power in your hand, your imagination can go wild now! Better yet, it can work on other people too. All the characters you wanted to be or thought of being, how exciting!

If only it worked quite that way.

Little do you know, the ring has a catch. 'You' won't just be becoming those characters, they'll be becoming you! Once you put on the ring and start to change into a character, your everyday life and personality will take over their character and body, remaining 'you' in some way, while still being drastically different.

For example, if some fanciful character were accessed, it would just become them as some silly kid. If a talking cartoon animal or anime were to be made from your mom, they'd suddenly think they were your mom, while becoming a subdued version of themselves. If the hero of a Novel or Show is created around your little sister, that's who they'll think the are while trying to adjust. The new character retains slights of their personality and behavior, while still trying to fulfill the new role they've been cast in.

Basically, think of it like that character is forced to try to "Act" like they're in a movie, with the "Role" being whoever they've replaced themselves as. Often to hilarious or ridiculous results.

Once changed, a person-turned-character can only be reverted back with the Ring. They won't be able to properly react or realize it before than.

For even further effect, the ring can work multiple times on a single person, meaning you can make a Character think they're another character thinking they're the transformed person they replaced!

I set up some basic characters and hopefully utilized the concept right, so any other new characters or fictions you want to use are perfectly open and on the table, so long as it goes with the Interactive's premise. I'm not going to nitpick or hound anyone that "Doesn't Get it right" or insist you understand perfectly, just try your best and have fun, and I'll make sure to help anyone along if they feel they need or want it!

Some basic rules:
1.Try the best you can, I know the concept is a little confusing but if you get the hang of it can be a lot of fun!
2.No gratuitous Violence or Sex please, try to keep it clean.
3.Use proper grammar and spelling, and add chapters that are acceptable and advance the story
4.Don't be afraid to experiment and have fun with it!
5.Be respectful and mindful of other people and their contributions, go with the flow ya know?
6.And lastly, biggest pet peeve of mine, you have to add actual story. No chains of long options past the beginning portion (first 10 chapters), no "Should X or Y" request, and if I see just entire branches of dead storylines that go nowhere or no one wants to take up and write I'm just going to delete them. Even 'Option' chapters should have atleast 100-300 words minimum.

I'm stating this as a major beef because I'm allowing fictional characters in this, and that's something that rarely goes well in these types of stories. If you make a suggestion for a series or character, you better be prepared to use it or waddle your way towards what you need to use. Don't just offer options and expect other people to write them out for you, don't offer suggestions you know won't be written. Basically I'm just trying to avoid the '1000 chapters of Character Possibilities but no real story' scenario
